byline.contributor: Mujib Mashal reported from Kabul, and Taimoor Shah from Kandahar, Afghanistan.
byline.original: By MUJIB MASHAL and TAIMOOR SHAH

abstract: United States-led coalition reports that two NATO soldiers were killed after men posing as Afghan security forces attacked military base in Helmand Province; efforts to battle Taliban suffer another loss when Musa Qala, strategic district of province, falls into Taliban hands after all-night battle.
lead_paragraph: Two NATO members, whose nationalities were not immediately clear, were shot on a base in the southern province of Helmand, a coalition statement said.

headline.main: Two Setbacks for Coalition in Afghanistan
headline.print_headline: Two Setbacks for Coalition in Afghanistan

snippet: Two NATO members, whose nationalities were not immediately clear, were shot on a base in the southern province of Helmand, a coalition statement said.

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
